info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:20PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catawba, southern Alexander, Lincoln, southwestern Iredell, southeastern Caldwell, eastern Cleveland, Gaston, southeastern Burke, York, eastern Cherokee and northeastern Union Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 720 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Hickory to 9 miles southwest of York. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Hickory, Shelby, Newton, Lincolnton, York, Statesville, Rock Hill, Kings Mountain and Mt Holly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western and the Piedmont of North Carolina...and Upstate South Carolina.
